DESCRIPTION: Gets the values of each record returned from an executed query. ColdFusion does not evaluate the arguments.
EXAMPLE: <!--- use the contents of one query to create another dynamically ---> <cfset List = "'BIOL', 'CHEM'"> <!--- first, get the department IDs in our list ---> <cfquery name = "GetDepartments" datasource = "cfdocexamples"> SELECT Dept_ID FROM Departments WHERE Dept_ID IN (#PreserveSingleQuotes(List)#) </cfquery> <!--- now, select the courses for that department based on the quotedValueList produced from our previous query ---> <cfquery name = "GetCourseList" datasource = "cfdocexamples"> SELECT * FROM CourseList WHERE Dept_ID IN ('#GetDepartments.Dept_ID#') </cfquery> <!--- now, output the results ---> List the course numbers that are in BIOL and CHEM (uses semicolon (;) as the delimiter):<br> <cfoutput> #QuotedValueList(GetCourseList.CorNumber,";")#<br> </cfoutput>

Parameter.DESCRIPTION: Name of an executed query and column. Separate query name and column name with a period.
A string or a variable that contains one. Character(s) that separate column data.
